pr_title: fix: paging breaks with + sign on phone number

timeline.message: fix: paging breaks with + sign on phone number

timeline.bodyText: This is not the proper solution and there are many other characters which this would not solve for. Proper changes are needed in com.twilio.http.Request.buildURL()
timeline.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: buildURL() appears to be constructing the URL properly (I compared the current method with the method prior to #558). The issue seems to be within encodeParameters() where each parameter is encoded. In the case of a phone number, it appears we should not encode the + sign. contructURL() is where we add the parameters to the final URL.
replies.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: The first page works fine which is where encodeParameters is called. The second page fails because buildURL is re-encoding the already-encoded parameters.
replies.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText:
I'm not seeing where buildURL is re-encoding the parameters. Might be easier to talk through it?
I added code to decode each value first before encoding. That seems to work locally, checking tests.
replies.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_fragment

The fragment identifier introduced by a hash mark # is the optional last part of a URL for a document.

This places it before the query.
What about just decoding the query part before constructing the URI?
timeline.author: childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: new URI().toString() from a new URI().toString()? This looks even more overly-complicated. Can we just drop the usage of URI and construct the URL similar to what we do in other languages?
timeline.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: I'll give constructing the URL manually a shot.
replies.author: thinkingserious

timeline.author: childish-sambino
childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: Does this handle URLs with embedded credentials.
timeline.author: childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: This needs to use a proper encoder. There are many other characters that it would cover.
timeline.author: childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: Simplify these for readability: String query = parsedUrl.getQuery() != null ? "?" + parsedUrl.getQuery() : null;
timeline.author: eshanholtz

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand this pathPieces logic. Needs a comment.
timeline.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: Comment added. The idea is to only encode the path portion of the URL.
replies.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: So if you have /foo|bar/baz|qux only baz/qux gets encoded?
replies.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: Yes, baz|qux would only be encoded. Based on our tests, I'm assuming this case does not happen. If we do expect that use case, then perhaps we should encode all pieces of the path, save / characters.
replies.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: We don't control where the characters needing encoding would be. Best to encode them all.
replies.author: childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: Spacing looks off. Are you using IntelliJ to format?
timeline.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: Nice! The formatter caught a stray space after credentials.
replies.author: thinkingserious

timeline.bodyText: Default limit is already 0 so second arg not needed.
timeline.author: childish-sambino

timeline.message: encode all pieces of the path

timeline.bodyText:
Could do one more simplification here similar to below:
String urlPort = parsedUrl.getPort() != -1 ? ":" + parsedUrl.getPort() : null;
timeline.author: eshanholtz
